domain

Class CritterWaveFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • domain.CritterWaveFactory

  • public class CritterWaveFactory
extends java.lang.Object

    The Critter Engine Class

    This class encapsulates all the methods relating solely to the creation of waves of critters that will be spawned on the map. This class takes advantage of the singleton design pattern and the factory design pattern

    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Justin Asfour

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static CritterWaveFactory getInstance()

      • createWave

        public java.util.Queue<Critter> createWave(Map map)
        The method creates a group of Critter. It implements the Singleton Design Pattern. The number of critters in each group changes based on each wave. As the player progresses through the game, the number of critters and the type that get dispatched changes instead of the strength of the critters. This is how difficulty is increased with each wave. Final wave is against BossCritter.
        Parameters:
        map - This parameter will give the critters an idea of where they are allowing them to move along the path

      • restartWaves

        public void restartWaves()
        This method is used to simply restart the wave back to zero
